what: Wrangles data to let you evaluate the predictive accuracy of February 2nd prognosticators
title: Wrangles data to let you evaluate the predictive accuracy of February 2nd prognosticators
text: Every year February 2, famous groundhog Punxsutawney Phil, growing cast creatures—living, stuffed, humans oversized costumes—emerge burrows predict weather. Punxsutawney Phil, prognosticator prognosticators, predicting weather since 1887. sees shadow, prediction six weeks winter. , predicts early spring. packaage brings together prediction data countdowntogroundhogday.com weather data U.S. National Ocean Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) help evaluate prognosticators can trust. License: CC0 1.0 Universal (see notes data licenses)

title: Wrangles data to let you evaluate the predictive accuracy of February 2nd prognosticators

text: table listing average monthly high temperature location year, 15-year running average monthly high temperature location, early spring/long winter classifications month, year, location.

title: Weather classifications, data, definition 1 — class_def1_data
text: data frame 32912 rows 7 columns: prognosticator_city prognosticator located year Classification year yearmo Classification year-month month Classification month tmax_monthly_mean_f Average monthly high temperature per location month year. Daily high temperatures averaged across 10 weather stations near location. Monthly data averaged daily summaries. Degrees Fahrenheit. tmax_monthly_mean_f_15y 15-year running average monthly high temperature location. Degrees Fahrenheit. class Classification: early spring long winter
